comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Presumably en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fanny_Schnelle "Fanny Schnelle (30 November 1866 – 31 January 1953) was a Norwegian politician for the Liberal Left Party."

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: The Washington times. (Washington [D.C.]), 18 May 1909. Page 3, column 1 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn84026749/1909-05-18/ed-... lists Fannie Schnelle as one of five Scandinavian women arriving in New York en route to the International Suffragists Congress in Toronto. The [New York] sun., December 26, 1915, page 1, col 2 chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn83030272/1915-12-26/ed-... names Mrs. Fanny Schnelle, a member of the town concil of Bergen as a delegate to a neutral conference associated with Henry Ford's peace mission to Europe. digitalarkivet.no/sab/bergensposten2/gymnast.htm has a photo of a Fanny Schnelle (also born in 1866) who appears to have been a gymnast and could easily be the same woman (rather younger).

comment.author: 23103743@N05
